title: Orientation & Introduction
description: Introduce simulator rules, scoring, and campaign structure.

tasks.prompt: Welcome to the Federal Candidate Simulator! You'll manage Candidate Coins (CC), signatures, and voter approval. CC = funds, signatures = grassroots support, approval = polling.
Declare your candidacy: Are you running for President, Senate, or House?

title: Independent / Write-In Filing
description: Teach filing requirements for independents and write-ins.

tasks.prompt: Independents and write-ins must file with the Texas Secretary of State. They can either pay a filing fee or collect petition signatures. Deadlines: May (independent) and August (write-in).
Which TWO options are valid ways to file as an independent or write-in candidate?
tasks.correctAnswer: Pay filing fee, Collect valid signatures

title: Party Filing
description: Teach filing requirements for party candidates.

tasks.prompt: Party candidates must be nominated through primaries or conventions, then file with the Secretary of State. They must pay the filing fee or collect valid signatures.
How do party candidates usually secure nomination?

title: Independent FEC Filing Quiz
description: Quiz on federal filing rules for independents.

tasks.prompt: Which FEC form names your treasurer and requires bank account info?

title: Party FEC Filing Quiz
description: Quiz on federal filing rules for party candidates.

tasks.prompt: Which FEC form starts quarterly reporting for party candidates?

title: First Moves (Strategy & Spending)
description: Practice early campaign decisions and budgeting.

tasks.prompt: Plan your first campaign moves: advertising, travel, or press outreach.
AI will evaluate your strategy and update CC, signatures, and approval.

title: Campaign Identity
description: Define slogans, mission, and public messaging.

tasks.prompt: Draft your campaign slogan.
Write your mission statement.
Prepare your campaign announcement speech.

title: Campaign Expansion
description: Design visuals and expand community outreach.

tasks.prompt: Describe your campaign logo, yard signs, or T-shirt design.
Decide how to spend CC on design, volunteers, and endorsements.

title: September Compliance & Scenarios
description: Review FEC Form 3, complete compliance quiz, and handle scenarios.

tasks.prompt: When must FEC Form 3 be filed?
Choose how to handle Constitution Day outreach, a constituent postcard, and a debate invitation.

title: Early October Ops
description: Manage team, deliver a community safety speech, and respond to weekly news.

tasks.prompt: Assign staff to outreach, fundraising, or media prep.
Deliver a community safety speech.

title: Mid-October Ops
description: Practice press conferences and constituent engagement.

tasks.prompt: Answer questions from reporters and constituents.

title: Final Push
description: Manage podcast appearance, media engagement, and final narrative.

tasks.prompt: Draft your final campaign message for undecided voters.

title: Election Countdown
description: Handle rapid Q&A, town halls, and endgame strategy.

tasks.prompt: Answer lightning round questions from voters.
Decide your endgame strategy: ads, ground game, or debate prep.

title: School Visit
description: Engage with students, teachers, and parents.

tasks.prompt: Deliver a short speech on education and civic engagement.

title: TV Interview
description: Prepare for live, high-pressure media questioning.

tasks.prompt: Answer journalist questions about your campaign platform.

title: Endorsements
description: Weigh benefits and risks of endorsements.

tasks.prompt: Decide whether to accept or decline endorsements.
Deliver your opening statement and answer 2 debate-style questions.

title: Final Summary
description: AI generates a narrative summary of the campaign.

tasks.prompt: Review your final campaign stats and narrative outcome.
